data: Only providers of the Addiction Medicine Service can prescribe injectable diacetylmorphine treatment for opioid use disorder
If IV access is lost, contact provider for IM diacetylmorphine orders immediately
Consider the possible need for dose adjustment if patient has been off injectable opioid agonist treatment for greater than 24 hours
Alert patients' community pharmacy of hospitalization and consider discontinuation of community injectable opioid agonist treatment prescription if ordering in hospital
Discontinue all previous hospital diacetylmorphine orders prior to initiating injectable opioid agonist treatment
